text: hanging from Orion's belt in the blade
of the hunters sword is a jeweled cloud
known as the Orion Nebula space here is
littered with small globs of gas and
dust
these are protostars baby stars in the
making
stellar cocoons cosmic tadpoles they
form in galactic nurseries like Orion
from clouds of gas and dust mingled with
the ashes of earlier stars that have
died and exploded but like all newborns
the young star faces a perilous future
buried inside this dusty cocoon our
astronomers can't see with regular
telescopes the secret stars being born
as the baby star tries to burn its way
out of the cloudy egg that sheltered and
birthed it radiation from powerful stars
nearby eats away the cocoon from the
outside to much outside radiation can
burn away not just the cocoon but the
disc around the new star leaving the
star naked and alone if the disc
survives it could make planets first by
electrical forces as particles randomly
collide and stick then by gravity as
clumps attract each other as a planet
forms it will scour its orbit of dust
leaving a telltale gap like the grooves
in a record
recently astronomers using the new Alma
radio telescope have made the most
detailed picture yet of what might be
planets being born they found dark Gru's
scouring a disc around a star known as
HL Tauri some 450 light years from here
the disc is about 22 billion miles
across about four times the size of the
realm of the planets in our own solar
system are these gaps sheltering planets
are we seeing the curtain rising on a
new set of worlds like our own HL Tauri
is only a million years old
a blink in the long lifetime of a star
for newborn Sun every grain of dust is a
promise it's morning in the Milky Way
everything is still possible
